    • Constructor Detail

      • HeavySprite

        public HeavySprite(java.lang.String spriteLocation,
                   int xLength,
                   int yLength,
                   int rows,
                   int columns,
                   int frameRate,
                   boolean repeats)
        Creates a sprite that can be animated. Sprite sheets must have an equal amount of sprites on each row or column
        Parameters:
        spriteLocation - File location of spritesheet
        xLength - Size of each sprite's width
        yLength - Size of each sprite's height
        rows - Amount of rows
        columns - Amount of columns
        frameRate - How many in game frames pass before next animation is run
        repeats - Determines if animation is played over and over again

      • HeavySprite

      • getSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite(int xLoc,
                                              int yLoc)
        Retrieves a subimage of the sprite at a certain location within the image Method can only be used with equally sized images within a spritesheet
        Parameters:
        xLoc - xLocation of the subimage
        yLoc - yLocation of the subimage
        Returns:
        The image contained at the given location in the form of a Buffered Image

        xLoc - xLocation of the subimage
        yLoc - yLocation of the subimage
        xLength - Length of the image
        yLength - Width of the image
        Returns:

      • rotateImage

        public void rotateImage(double degrees)
        Description copied from class: Sprite
        Used for rotating the image (using degrees). All rotations are "Nearest Neighbor" rotations, allowing individual pixels to keep their relative form. The currentRotated() cardinalRotate() are better for general use.
        Overrides:
        rotateImage in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        degrees - Degrees in which the image is rotate.

      • rotateAll
